thread.title: Setting tails wagging: the costumed pups of the Rio dog carnival
thread.title_full: Setting tails wagging: the costumed pups of the Rio dog carnival

author: Yasuyoshi Chiba
title: Setting tails wagging: the costumed pups of the Rio dog carnival
text: Yasuyoshi Chiba Monday 20 February 2017 07.00 GMT A dog dressed in costume is seen during the Rio dog carnival, known as the Blocao – with ‘bloco’ meaning street party and ‘cao’ dog – during pre-carnival celebrations at Copacabana beach Down to clown: two dogs look set for tomfoolery as they look around for mischief at the Rio dog carnival Top hat for a top dog: this pooch sports a pink and green hat offering at least some sun protection at Copacabana beach Showing off their canines: an owner and her dog are all smiles as they dress to match at the dog carnival Lip smacking: this dog has seeen something it likes among the crowd at Copacabana beach Pucker up: two pups get friendly during the parade where dogs in costumes get together to set the stage a week ahead of the famed Rio carnival Throw your paws in the air like you just don’t care: a very patient dog adds to the party atmosphere Topics
